sn7.5:1.2: Then the brahmin Ahiṃsaka Bhāradvāja, Bhāradvāja the Harmless, approached the Blessed One and exchanged greetings with him. When they had concluded their greetings and cordial talk,
sn7.5:1.3: he sat down to one side  and said to the Blessed One:
sn7.5:1.4: “I am Ahiṃsaka the Harmless, Master Gotama. I am Ahiṃsaka the Harmless, Master Gotama. ”
sn7.5:2.1: [The Blessed One: ]   “If one were as one’s name implies
sn7.5:2.2: You would be a harmless one.
sn7.5:2.4: But it is one who does no harm at all  or mind,
sn7.5:2.5: Who really is a harmless one
sn7.5:2.6: As he does not harm others. ”
sn7.5:3.1: When this was said, the brahmin Ahiṃsaka Bhāradvāja said to the Blessed One:
sn7.5:3.4: And the Venerable Ahiṃsaka Bhāradvāja became one of the arahants.
